Comment: Not an uncommon opening. The idea is to get the KBP forward before planting the KN on the natural square, enabling this P to participate in a K-side thrust. And of course to veer down less explored paths than, say, the Queen's Gambit or the Ruy Lopez.
Focusing attention on Black's K4.
Focusing attention on Black's K4.

This opening is almost a mirror reflection of the English Opening. In that one, White plays P-QB4 and N-QB3, focusing on the light squares in the center. Here, White's focus is on the dark central squares.
